definition[0]: an amount of money that is paid back to you when you have paid too much tax, rent etc
example[0]: You may be entitled to a tax rebate.
definition[1]: an amount of money that is paid back to you when you have paid too much
example[1]: 1.6 million tenants claimed a rent rebate.
example[2]: You may get a rebate on your car insurance, if your car is off the road for at least 28 days.
definition[2]: part of the price that is paid back to customers when they buy something
example[3]: Ford is offering a $2,000 rebate on this model.
definition[3]: to pay part of the price of something back to customers when they buy it. In some places it can be illegal to do this
example[4]: the agency’s practice of rebating to its clients part of the commission it receives from the sale of securities
definition[4]: to pay an amount of money back to someone when they have paid too much
example[5]: Council members want to rebate half the city’s $21 million surplus to taxpayers.
